AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol: law enforcement agency whose agents apprehended illegal alien smugglers and had reason to suspect the presence of illegal aliens in Maria De Jesus Garcia's pickup truck, entitled to question occupants about their citizenship and immigration status after a stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Maria De Jesus Garcia's Vehicle: pickup truck driven by Maria De Jesus Garcia, subject of a stop and search by border patrol agents where occupants exhibited suspicious behavior, including hygienic appearances that were considered in assessing reasonable suspicion for the stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Interstate Highway 35: highway where Maria De Jesus Garcia was stopped, known as a common smuggling route with a history of alien smuggling
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States-Mexico Border: geographic location related to the case, relevant for determining the origin of vehicles and individuals, used as a reference point for distance calculation
